content:
DEPARTMENT OF STATE AGENCY FOR INTERNATIONAL DEVELOPMENT UNITED STATES AID MISSION TO CHINA
MC- 3701
MAY 1 7 1962
Mr. C. C. Chang Chief, Second Division Council For United States Aid Taipei, Taiwan
Subject: Excess Property
Ref
: Letter No. C2-62-1509 dated May 12, 1962
Dear Mr. Chang,
The reason why the US AID/C technicians or officers responsible to effect the transfer did not notify CUSA Third Division of the time and place of transfer was because they were not aware that the items had been assigned and were being transferred. As pointed out in our letter MC-3529 of May 2, 1962, the disposition was arbitrarily made without reference to US AID/C technicians, hence the reason for calling your attention to 3 A and B of Memorandum MC-2407 dated January 25, 1962. The memorandum calls for concurrence by the technician as well as CUSA.
As requested in your referenced letter P/SP will issue purchase orders for all items enumerated in J. G. White's letter of April 27, 1962.
Upon receipt of your letter C2-62-1431 dated May 8, 1962, the list showing disposition as proposed by the Coordinator, KaHB was forwarded to our Industry Division and the technicians responsible for the various projects were requested to advise P/SP if they concurred. After checking out the listed items the technicians proceeded to Tainan Air Station and inspected the available equipment and have requested disposition as shown on the attached list. Will you please intimate whether you concur in this revised allocation. An early reply is requested to enable us to issue the purchase orders promptly.
Sincerely yours, 1-Rotter
H. T. Potter Supply Advisor
國史饭 Academia Historica
392

Mr. C. C. Chang Chief, Second Division Council For United States Aid Taipei, Taiwan

The reason why the US AID/C technicians or officers responsible to effect the transfer did not notify CUSA Third Division of the time and place of transfer was because they were not aware that the items had been assigned and were being transferred. As pointed out in our letter MC-3529 of May 2, 1962, the disposition was arbitrarily made without reference to US AID/C technicians, hence the reason for calling your attention to 3 A and B of Memorandum MC-2407 dated January 25, 1962. The memorandum calls for concurrence by the technician as well as CUSA.
As requested in your referenced letter P/SP will issue purchase orders for all items enumerated in J. G. White's letter of April 27, 1962.

Upon receipt of your letter C2-62-1431 dated May 8, 1962, the list showing disposition as proposed by the Coordinator, KaHB was forwarded to our Industry Division and the technicians responsible for the various projects were requested to advise P/SP if they concurred. After checking out the listed items the technicians proceeded to Tainan Air Station and inspected the available equipment and have requested disposition as shown on the attached list. Will you please intimate whether you concur in this revised allocation. An early reply is requested to enable us to issue the purchase orders promptly.
